premise: The image contains four objects: a black sphere (A), a blue cylinder (B), a pink circular object (C), and a rectangular object (D). Each object casts a shadow on the ground.
If the light source moves forward above the objects, the shadows will change in both position and size.
As the light source moves forward, the shadows will move in the opposite direction (toward the light source). This means the shadows will appear closer to the objects.
The size of the shadows will increase because the light source is now closer to the objects, resulting in longer shadows.
Based on the movement of the light source, the shadows will both move closer to the objects and become larger.
